title: Antonio Paganin
text:
Antonio Paganin (born 18 June 1966) is an Italian former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player, who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>. He is the brother of <a href="Massimo%20Paganin">Massimo Paganin</a>, who was also a football player.
Career.
Paganin was born in <a href="Vicenza">Vicenza</a>. He began his career with <a href="Bologna%20F.C.%201909">Bologna</a> (1982–1984) in the lower divisions, later moving to <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> club <a href="U.C.%20Sampdoria">Sampdoria</a> (1984–88), and winning two <a href="Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia</a> trophies during his time with the club. He moved to <a href="Udinese%20Calcio">Udinese</a> for two seasons (1988–90), helping the team to earn <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> promotion, before moving to <a href="F.C.%20Internazionale%20Milano">Internazionale</a> (1990–95), where he won the <a href="UEFA%20Cup">UEFA Cup</a> twice, in 1991 and in 1994. He later played with <a href="Atalanta%20B.C.">Atalanta</a> (1995–96), and <a href="Hellas%20Verona%20F.C.">Verona</a> (1996–97), where he concluded his <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> career, before moving to Torri Quartesolo (1997–99), and later ending his career with <a href="U.C.%20Montecchio%20Maggiore">Montecchio Maggiore</a> (1999–2003), in the lower divisions.
Honours.
Inter
Sampdoria
